REST API main¶

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.ban_user(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The ban_user function takes an email address and a database connection, and sets the user.is_active to False.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user to ban

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.change_user_role(email: str, role: str, db: Session) → None¶

The change_user_role function takes an email and a role, then finds the user with that email in the database. It then sets that user’s role to be equal to the given role.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the user by email

  • role – Role: Specify the role of the user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function sets the confirmed field of a user to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A user object

async src.repository.users.delete_user(user_id: int, db: Session)¶

The delete_user function deletes a user from the database.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Specify the id of the user to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.get_me(user: User, db: Session)¶

The get_me function returns the user object of the currently logged in user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass the user object to the function

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A user object

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user associated with that email.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the type of parameter that will be passed to the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

async src.repository.users.get_user_profile(username: str, db: Session) → User¶

The get_user_profile function returns a UserProfileModel object containing the user’s username, email, avatar, created_at date and time (in UTC), is_active status (True or False), photo count and comment count.

Parameters:

  • username – str: Get the username of the user who is trying to access their profile

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

async src.repository.users.get_users(skip: int, limit: int, db: Session) → List[User]¶

The get_users function returns a list of users from the database.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n records in the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of users

async src.repository.users.remove_from_ban(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The remove_from_ban function removes a user from the ban list.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the user by email

  • db – Session: database session

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.save_black_list_token(token: str, user: User, db)¶
The save_black_list_token function saves a token to the blacklist.
Args:

token (str): The JWT auth_token that is being saved to the blacklist. current_user (User): The user who’s token is being saved to the blacklist.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Pass the token that is being blacklisted

  • current_user – auth_service.get_current_user: Get the current user

  • db – Access the database

Returns:

The token that was saved

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of parameter that is being passed into the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user in the database

  • token – str | None: Update the refresh_token field in the user table

  • db – Session: Commit the changes to the database

Returns:

None

REST API repository Photos¶

src.repository.photos.create_or_get_tag(titles: list[str], user_id: int, db: Session)¶

Create or get tag :param titles: titles of the tags :type tags: list[str] :param user_id: the id of the user :type user_id: int :param db: The database session :type db: Session :return: list of tags :rtype: List[Tag]

async src.repository.photos.create_photo(title: str, description: str, tags: List[str], current_user: User, file: UploadFile, db: Session) → Photo¶

Create a new photo for a specific user :param title: title of the photo :type title: str :param description: description of the photo :type description: str :param tags: tags of the photo :type tags: List[Tag] :param current_user: The user to create the photo for :type current_user: User :param file: image :type file: UploadFile :param db: The database session :type db: Session :return: photo created :rtype: Photo

async src.repository.photos.get_photo(photo_id: int, current_user: User, db: Session) → Photo¶

Get a photo of the specified id :param photo_id: id of the photo :type photo_id: int :param current_user: The user to retrieve photos for. :type current_user: User :param db: The database session :type db: Session :return: Photo of the specified id :rtype: Photo

async src.repository.photos.get_photo_by_id(photo_id: int, current_user: User, db: Session) → Photo¶

Get a photo with the specified id for a specific user and filter by user_role :param photo_id: id of the photo :type photo_id: int :param current_user: The user to retrieve photos for. :type current_user: User :param db: The database session :type db: Session :return: photo filtered by role :rtype: Photo

async src.repository.photos.get_photos(skip, limit, db: Session) → List[Photo]¶

Get list of photos with the specified number :param skip: The number of contacts to skip. :type skip: int :param limit:The maximum number of contact to return. :type limit: int :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: a list of photos :rtype: List[Photo]

async src.repository.photos.get_user_photos(skip, limit, current_user, db) → List[Photo]¶

async src.repository.photos.remove_photo(photo_id: int, current_user: User, db: Session) → Photo | None¶

Remove a photo :param photo_id: id photo to remove :param current_user: The user to retrieve photos for. :type current_user: User :param db: The database session :type db: Session :return: photo or None :rtype: Photo | None

async src.repository.photos.update_photo(photo_id: int, title: str, description: str, tags: List[str], current_user: User, file: UploadFile, db: Session) → Photo | None¶

Update a photo for a specific user by specific id :param photo_id: id photo to update :type photo_id: int :param title: title of the photo :type title: str :param description: description of the photo :rtype description: str

Parameters:

  • tags (List[Tag]) – tags of the photo

  • current_user (User) – user who updated the photo

  • file – file of the photo

  • db (Session) – The database session

Type:

UploadFile

Returns:

the updated photo

Return type:

Photo

REST API repository Comments¶

async src.repository.comments.create_comment(db: Session, comment_data: CommentModel, photo_id: int, user_id: int)¶
The create_comment function creates a new comment for an image.
Args:

db (Session): The database session to use for creating the comment. comment_data (CommentModel): The data of the new Comment object to create. photo_id (int): The id of the Photo that this Comment is associated with. user_id (int): The id of the User that created this Comment.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • comment_data – CommentModel: Pass the data of a comment to the function

  • photo_id – int: Identify the photo that the comment is being made on

  • user_id – int: Identify the user who created the comment

Returns:

The comment object that was created

Doc-author:

Trelent

The delete_comment function deletes a comment from the database.

  • comment_id – int: Specify which comment to delete

Returns:

The deleted comment

Doc-author:

Trelent

Returns:

Comment: A Comment object containing all information about a given comment.

  • photo_id – int: Filter the comment by photo_id

async src.repository.comments.get_comment_photo_user_id(db: Session, photo_id: int, user_id: int)¶
The get_comment_photo_user_id function returns the comment (with photo_id) of the user with user_id.
Args:

db (Session): The database session to use for querying. photo_id (int): The id of the photo to query comments from. user_id (int): The id of the user who made a comment on this photo.

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Filter the comments by photo_id

  • user_id – int: Filter the comments by user_id

A comment object

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the message &quot;email confirmed&quot;

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dictionary with the access token, refresh token and a bearer type

async src.routes.auth.logout(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), current_user: UserModel = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The logout function is used to logout a user.

It takes the token of the user and returns a message that says User logged out successfully;.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token of the user

  • current_user – UserBase: Get the user who is logged in

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dictionary with the status code, detail and token

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token (bearer).

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dict with the keys access_token, refresh_token and token_type

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link to confirm their account.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background_tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary {‘message’: ‘check your email for confirmation’}

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The signup function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the user data from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add tasks to the background task queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the server

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with two keys: user and detail

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.ban_user_by_email(body: RequestEmail, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The ban_user_by_email function takes a user’s email address and bans the user from accessing the API.

If the email is not found in our database, an HTTPException is raised with status code 401 (Unauthorized) and detail message &amp;quot;Invalid Email&amp;quot;. If the user has already been banned, an HTTPException is raised with status code 409 (Conflict) and detail message &amp;quot;User Already Not Active&amp;quot;. Otherwise, if no exceptions are thrown, we return a JSON object containing key-value pair {&amp;quot;message&amp;quot;

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict with the message

async src.routes.users.change_role_by_email(body: RequestRole, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The change_role_by_email function is used to change the role of a user.

The function takes in an email and a role, and changes the user’s role to that specified by the inputted parameters. If no such user exists, then an HTTPException is raised with status code 401 (Unauthorized) and detail message &quot;Invalid Email&quot;. If the new role matches that of the current one, then a message saying so will be returned. Otherwise, if all goes well, then a success message will be returned.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestRole: Get the email and role from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A dictionary with a message key

async src.routes.users.delete_user(user_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The delete_user function deletes a user from the database.
Args:

user_id (int): users.id will be deleted. db (Session, optional): SQLAlchemy Session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Identify the user to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

A user object

async src.routes.users.get_all_users(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 10, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_all_users function returns a list of users.

summary: Returns all users. description: This can only be done by the logged in user. operationId: read_all_users parameters: skip: (optional) # The number of records to skip before returning results, default is 0 (no records skipped).

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n records

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • db – Session: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

A list of users

async src.routes.users.get_user_profile_by_username(username: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_user_profile_by_username function is used to read a user profile by username.

The function takes in the username as an argument and returns the user profile if it exists.

Parameters:

  • username – str: Get the username from the url path

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • current_user – User: Get the current user’s information

Returns:

A userprofile object

The get_users_me function returns the current user’s information.

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository

Returns:

A user object

async src.routes.users.remove_from_ban(body: RequestEmail, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The remove_from_ban function removes a user from the ban list.

The function takes an email as input and returns a message if successful.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict with message

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_avatar_user function updates the avatar of a user.
Args:

file (UploadFile): The image to be uploaded as an avatar. current_user (User): The user whose avatar is being updated. db (Session): A database session object for interacting with the database.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Upload the file to cloudinary

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

The user object with the new avatar_url, but i want to return only the avatar_url

A list of tags.

Return type:

List[Tag]

REST API routes Comments¶

async src.routes.comments.create_comment(photo_id: int, comment: CommentModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The create_comment function creates a new comment for the image with the given ID. The user who created this comment is determined by the JWT token in the request header.

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Get the photo that the comment is being made on

  • comment – CommentModel: Create a new comment

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

:param : Get the database session :return: A commentmodel object

async src.routes.comments.delete_comment(comment_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The delete_comment function deletes a comment from the database.

Only admins and moderators can delete comments.

Parameters:

  • comment_id – int: Get the comment id from the url path

  • db – Session: Get a database session

  • current_user – User: Get the user who is currently logged in

:param : Get the id of the comment to be deleted :return: The comment that was deleted :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.comments.edit_comment(comment_id: int, new_text: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The edit_comment function allows a user to edit their own comment.

The function takes the comment_id and new_text as parameters, and returns the updated comment.

Parameters:

  • comment_id – int: Identify the comment to be edited

  • new_text – str: Pass in the new text for the comment

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • current_user – User: Get the user that is making the request

:param : Get the comment id from the url :return: The updated comment object :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.comments.get_comment_photo_id_route(photo_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_comment_photo_id_route function returns all comments to a picture (photo_id).

Parameters:

  • photo_id – int: Get the photo_id from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

:param : Get the comment by photo id :return: A comment object with the photo_id :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.comments.get_comment_photo_user_id_route(db: Session = Depends(get_db), user_id: int | None = None, photo_id: int | None = None, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_comment_photo_user_id_route function returns a list of comments for the specified photo_id and user_id.

If user_id is not specified, it will return comments for the current logged in user.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • user_id – int: Get the comments of a specific user

  • photo_id – int: Get the photo_id from the url

  • current_user – User: Get the current user’s id

:param : Get the database connection :return: A list of comments from the database :doc-author: Trelent

REST API services Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): The data to be encoded in the JWT. This should include all of the claims that you want to make about this token, including any custom claims that you have defined. expires_delta (Optional[float]): A timedelta object representing how long this token will be valid for before it expires and is no longer usable by clients. If not provided, defaults to 180 minutes from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

A string, which is the encoded access token

create_email_token(data: dict)¶
The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a JWT token.

The token is encoded with the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM defined in the class. The iat (issued at) claim is set to datetime.utcnow() and exp (expiration time) claim is set to 7 days from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the token

Returns:

A token

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): The data to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The time until expiration of the token, defaults to 7 days if not specified.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the user’s id to the function

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

A token that contains the following:

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶
The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token.

The function will raise an HTTPException if the token is invalid or has expired. If the token is valid, it will return a string with the email address of user who owns that refresh_token.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user who requested the refresh token

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user associated with that token. If no user is found, it raises an exception.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass the token from the request header to the function

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A user object

async get_current_user_s(token: str = 'Depends(oauth2_scheme)', db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function uses the jwt library to decode the token, which is then used to retrieve the email address from within it.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass the token to the function

Returns:

The email address of the user

get_password_hash(password: str) → str¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the user class

  • password – str: Get the password from the user

Returns:

A hash of the password

get_token_user(db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_token_user function is a dependency that will be used by the get_current_user function. It takes in a token and returns the user associated with it.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Pass the token from the http request to this function

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The token, which is a string

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password) → bool¶
The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and the hashed version of that password,

and returns True if they match, False otherwise. This is used to verify that the user’s login credentials are correct.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Check the password entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Compare the hashed password from the database with the plain text password entered by user

Returns:

True if the password is correct and false otherwise

REST API services Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.
The function takes in three arguments:

-email: the user’s email address, which is used as a unique identifier for each account. -username: the username of the account that was just created. -host: this is used in conjunction with FastMail’s API to create a URL that will be sent via email and allow users to verify their accounts.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Validate the email address

  • username – str: Pass the username to the email template

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server where this app is running

Returns:

A coroutine object
